title: Richbased
author: Richbased
content: It is quite understanding how our names reflects in our behaviors and life style. In the ancient days our parents gives us names according to the circumstances that surrounded our birth. Like for example in igbo land when I woman experiences labour while walking along the road, when the child is born they will name the child as good road ( uzorma ), when a woman experiences labour while she embarked on a journey, as soon as the child is born they will name the child as good journey ( ijeoma ). Then when a child is born in a wealthy home , they name them good wealth ( Akumma ). It is important to give our children good names irrespective of the circumstances that surrounds their birth as the names we give them can also reflect and influence their attitudes in the society.Further more, a good names brings about positive vibes as if a child is given a good name and he/she begins to behave or act strange people when start telling them to act according to their name so when the child recalls the meaning of their names it can automatically make them change their behavior.Even the holy book ( bible ) made us to know in the book of Proverbs 22:1 that a good name is to be chosen rather than great riches, loving favor rather than silver and gold. So when you have a good name and you are acting according to your name people will start to emulate from you and even parents will start to give their children good name because of you.So we have to imbibe the habit of giving our children good names as life is a reflection of who we are and who we are is justified by our actions and our behavior in the society and bearing a good name is also advisable.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Good Name is definitely a good thing, I mean, as parents, it's a duty we owe to our children to give them a good name, and not just give them a good name, but also ensure that we encourage and help them to live their life in such a way it will allow their good name reflect in their lifestyle, since it popularly said that a good name is better than silver and gold, though the good name meant in this adage is not actually a good name but a good character, for it is a good character that the society refer to' as one having a good name.. For naming your child God or Jesus will not make that child behave like God or Jesus, it is the training and help given to that child that will help him or her to grow up and have a character that is close or near to resemblance of the character he or she is named after, for example, I've heard and read stories of people who were named jesus after birth, but they grow up to become criminals, kidnappers, set of demonic individuals causing several types of havoc and unrest in their then society.. So giving a child a good name is not where it ends, making sure that child grow up wit the best of training, education, encouragement and help is what will help the child live up to the good name he or she was named.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Bearing a good name is something worth it. It gives a positive vibes around you and wherever you find yourself but it does not just end in answering a good name. One can answer a good name but what are the attributes of the person bearing the name. These days, people do not look into names again but the person in question and how the bearer of the name tends to play out in the society. This is where I keyed into @Fivestar4everMVP idea and opinion.It is not all about giving a child a good name but the process involved in bringing up that child who bears that name to replicate or behave accordingly with the name they bear. Parents have a role to play when grooming their child to becoming reasonable people in the society. Every parent desire their child to be outstanding in the society and at such should be ready to do the needful by training their child to be in tandem with the name they bear.Nevertheless, the bible says in Proverbs 22:6 "train up a child in the way he should grow and when he grows he would never depart from it."  This is amongst the key tips to making sure a child grows and be a reflection of the name they bear. This goes along way to say that parents have a role to play in the life of their children till their maturity and age when they know the good and the bad.

comments.author: Yucky
comments.body: In essence, our names become a reflection of our identity, and the influence they have on our lives should not be underestimated. By bestowing upon our children names that carry positive connotations, we set the stage for them to embrace those qualities and make a positive impact in society. Let us continue to uphold the tradition of giving our children names that inspire greatness and encourage them to live up to their full potential.
